text:
Why do I have to give a user to send notifications to. I want the oauth user who is triggering the notification to receive the notification. Not giving a user, because then every user needs to make a workflow, I just want one workflow and send notifications to the oauth user.
Can this be done?
<@UFBNA9K9A> That sounds perfect, thank you very much for this!! Is that just part of the hs_context then?
Yup, exactly, right along side where you would put the `hutk`

Hi Thomas, sorry for the late response, I just joined the channel. There's 2 possible workarounds for this 1) you create a "mapping table"  (index) in your own environment or 2) you dynamically create lists with your custom property. I will be talking about this on <https://devday.splashthat.com/>
Perfect, thanks <@UFBNA9K9A>, ill try that now!
<@UFBNA9K9A> you sir are a legend, that worked!! Many thanks :smile:
haha, I don’t know if I’m ready for legend status but glad to be able to help you

The notification has to come from somewhere. So you need an account in HubSpot that has certain permissions to be able to do something, and that is the user that sends the notification. Generally this user could be <mailto:notification@domain.com|notification@domain.com> or some other generic address/login
